intro: Gomesa batemaniana, commonly known as the Bateman's gomesa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
